result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey P. Mertens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  Defendant's bond shall be applied towards the costs.

Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  If defendant's probation is revoked the 470 days jail credit shall first be applied to Taylor County Case No. 16CF16.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to Taylor Co. Case No. 16CF16 and any other sentence now and being including Clark Co. Case No. 16CF114.

superMiscConds.notes:
Costs have been paid in full from Defendant's bond.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations.

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: 10:03 AM Defendant Jeffrey P. Mertens in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jeffrey P. Mertens appeared by video means from Jackson Correctional Institution with Attorney Stephen Willett in person in Taylor County.  Statement by Attorney Tlusty.  Statement by Attorney Willett.  Statement by Jeffrey Mertens.  Court orders that the judgment of conviction shall be amended to 470 days sentence credit in 16CF16.  02CF41 - 2 additional days of sentence credit shall be given.  Clerk   17CF98 - the clerk shall amend the judgment of conviction as requested by DOC.   Mr. Mertens also indicated that he wanted the JOC to be changed to show that he is eligible for the substance abuse program.  Court finds Mr. Mertens is eligible for the substance abuse program in 16CF16 and 16CF31.  Clerk to amend JOC accordingly. - rt
Revoked - Sentenced to prison
of February 20, 2019 Sentencing Hearing

02:25 PM Defendant Jeffrey P. Mertens in court with attorney Stephen Donald Willett.  Defendant Jeffrey P. Mertens in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Willett requests correction to revocation packet as to pg. 24 as to correct maximum penalties on Ct. 1 on 16CF31.  Atty Tlusty corrects as to pg. 5 and does not object to correction.  Court agrees.  Argument on sentencing. Court takes judicial notice of Clark Co. Case No. 16CF114. No objection.  DE makes statement on sentencing.  Atty Tlusty states additional argument on sentencing.  Court imposed the following sentence on 16CF16: Ct. 1 - 8 years Wisconsin State Prison consisting of 3 years initial confinement and 5 years extended supervision, consecutive to any other sentence now and being including Clark Co. Case No. 16CF114. Conditions: Any supervision fees or any other obligations that were previously ordered.   Court imposed the following sentence on 16CF31: Ct. 1 - 3 years Wisconsin State Prison System with 1.5 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision, consecutive to 16CF16 and any other sentence now and being including Clark Co. Case No. 16CF114. Conditions: Any supervision fees or any other obligations that were previously ordered.  973 days of sentence credit to be added to 16CF16.  17CF98 - Atty Willett requests to adjourn Jury Trial due to surgery.  Court states there is speedy trial demand.  Atty Willett requests to withdraw speedy trial demand. DE makes statement agrees to withdraw.  No objection by the State.  Court reschedules Jury Trial.  Jury Trial scheduled April 8, 2019 at 8:30 a.m. set as #1. ba

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jeffrey P. Mertens in court with attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into record.  Victim rights complied with.  Plea of no contest to count 1.  Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty. The tracking citations are dismissed.   Statement by Attorney Tlusty and Attorney Kirkpatrick.  Statement by Jeffrey Mertens.  Court orders withheld sentence probation three years with conditions of court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Bond to be applied towards all costs in all of the cases.   470 days sentence credit.   If probation is revoked the jail credit is to be applied to 16CF16 first.  Appeal rights given to defendant.  - rt
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 28, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Jeffrey P. Mertens in court with attorney Andrew M. Morgan.  Defendant Jeffrey P. Mertens in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion to withdraw as counsel.  Defendant indicated that he wants to keep Mr. Morgan as his attorney.  Mr. Morgan indicated that he talked to the defendant and will still be his attorney.  Attorney Morgan is requesting that defendant's bond be reduced to a signature bond.  Statement by Attorney Tlusty objecting to the signature bond.  Court denies request to modify bond to a signature bond.  - rt

June 5, 2017 - 2:00 pm -  motion hearing on 16CF16.
